section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Your time of service is at its end, and you will have to give your account.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The hard-hearted Messenger of Death has come to take you away.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

translation.text: What have you earned, and what have you lost?

translation.text: Come immediately! You are summoned to His Court! ||1||

translation.text: Get going! Come just as you are! You have been summoned to His Court.

text: ਹਰਿ ਫੁਰਮਾਨੁ ਦਰਗਹ ਕਾ ਆਇਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Order has come from the Court of the Lord. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: har phuramān daragah kā āiā .1. rahāu .

translation.text: I pray to the Messenger of Death: please, I still have some outstanding debts to collect in the village.

text: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਜਾ ਕਉ ਹਰਿ ਰੰਗੁ ਲਾਗਾ ॥ ਧਨੁ ਧਨੁ ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਭਾਗਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Blessed, blessed is the most fortunate servant of the Lord, who is imbued with the Lord's Love, in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy.

transliteration.text: sādhasang jā kau har rang lāgā . dhan dhan sō jan purakh sabhāgā .
